repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Grace E. Snow was one of the first women to graduate from Storrs Agricultural College (1896), now the University of Connecticut. Collection contains her diploma, report card, dance program and publications.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: One of the first women to graduate from Storrs Agricultural School, Grace Edith Snow was from Storrs, Connecticut. Ms. Snow was presumably related to the David H. Snow who donated one hundred acres of land to the institution in 1909 and Anna M. Snow, the latter attending the school in 1891 before the official acceptance of women in 1893.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains memorabilia, awards and publications associated with Ms. Snow's attendance at the Storrs Agricultural College.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students, etc.]. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Grace E. Snow Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: dance program, class exercises, commencement program, diploma and a report card from Storrs Agricultural College.]
